intro: Lasthenia obtusifolia, commonly known as the bluntleaf rayhead, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaves with a distinctive, rounded shape. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its small yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the leaves are often covered in fine hairs. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates.
